intro: Cyanea koolauensis, commonly known as the Koolauensis Cyanea, is a rare flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Cyanea koolauensis is critically endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and propagate this unique Hawaiian species.
